title: FlashPaper software from Adobe
content:
Since everyone here I think uses Flash do people also use what I think is new Flash Paper? Here is an example, forget the quality of the design, focus on the Flash Paper application. It appears that you need only the Flash Paper application to make this work, but maybe I am wrong. Also appears to be for PC only, unless you spend some more bucks for add ons for MAC.

To me this looks like a very useful tool.

[http://www.lakechamplainislander.com/index.swf](http://web.archive.org/web/20080414234156/http:/www.lakechamplainislander.com/index.swf "http://www.lakechamplainislander.com/index.swf")

Jordan

 [‹ shortcut for smooth and sharp connections?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080414234156/http:/typophile.com/node/44146 "Go to previous forum topic") [Indesign: Dealing with a probably-corrupt file ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080414234156/http:/typophile.com/node/44078 "Go to next forum topic")
author: jordy

comments.content:
flash paper has been around for a while.

It certainly has its specific uses, but even though Adobe might have hoped so, it hasn’t changed the face of the web (nor would I have wanted it to ;o)

FlashPaper is pretty old. In fact, it hasn’t been updated in quite a while. Kind of cool, though.

T

Thanks for the news. I obviously don’t keep up with new apps or even old ones unless it is specifically type design related.

Jordan
